Package com.telenav.kivakit.commandline

Class SwitchParser<T>

java.lang.Object
com.telenav.kivakit.commandline.SwitchParser<T>
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.naming.Named
public class SwitchParser<T> extends Object implements com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.naming.Named
A switch parser that can be passed to CommandLine.get(SwitchParser) to retrieve a switch value.

Built-In Parsers

Numerous switch parser builders are provided by SwitchParsers.

Parser Builders

New switches can be created with the switch parser SwitchParser.Builder, which can be accessed through switchParser(Class). The type parameter is the type of the switch being built. For example, a float switch would be of type Float.class. The builder then allows attributes of the switch parser to be specified:

  • SwitchParser.Builder.name(String) - The name of the switch on the command line, like "input"
  • SwitchParser.Builder.description(String) - A description of what the switch does
  • SwitchParser.Builder.required() - The user must provide the switch or it is an error
  • SwitchParser.Builder.optional() - The user can omit the switch and a null or default value will result
  • SwitchParser.Builder.defaultValue(Object) - A default value if the switch is optional and omitted
  • SwitchParser.Builder.validValues(Set) - A set of allowable values for the switch
  • SwitchParser.Builder.converter(StringConverter) - A converter to convert the string value of the switch to an object

Example

This example provides a builder to create switch parsers for Version objects. The object specified on the command line will be converted from a string to a Version object with VersionConverter. Many classes in KivaKit provide string converters, which makes it an easy job to construct switch parsers. 

 public static Builder<Version> versionSwitchParser(Listener listener,
                                                    String name,
                                                    String description)
 {
     return switchParser(Version.class)
         .name(name)
         .converter(new Version.Converter(listener))
         .description(description);
 }
